page.title: 08The Situation of Bangor
page.content: Bangor lies in and on the westerly side of a valley which runs from south west to north east. The{River Adda flows through it, but is now guided in culverts under the city. The main shopping area now covers the floor of the valley whilst on the western ridge are found the main university buildings, the small shopping area of Upper Bangor and private houses. The north eastern ridge is very rocky and known locally as{Bangor Mountain. Because the ground where the valley meets the sea is so low the high tides rise the water table at the lower end of the valley, the Engineering building of the university is built where this soft ground meets firmer earth and has pumps in the basement to keep the foundations stable. Several other buildings in this area have special foundations.
